caption: This place is amazing!!! The kachapuris (viking-like bread boats with cheese, butter, and egg, or spinach, or pork belly etc) are so delicious. Their Khinkalis (Georgian dumplings) are outstanding too. Don't miss their fries. We ordered from this place like once a week. They have a great outdoor seating. They have an indoor garage door so have great air circulation. Their take out is super fast and always top notch. What else can I say, try this joint out.. we love it!!

The food is delicious and, in my opinion, well-sized for portions. I had the ajaruli khachapuri, which was very satisfying and quite generous with the delicious sulguni cheese. The wine selection is also very nice. I will probably try the pkhali, satsivi, and the spinach and artichoke khachapuri on future visits - those looked good!  The bathroom wallpaper of the translation of Diary of a Wimpy Kid in Georgian adds a really cute touch.  I would say that the first-come-first-serve aspect for the outdoor tables seems to be a bit disorganized - allowing folks to put their name down would probably make the process a bit more relaxing for customers and a lot less stressful for the staff, who seemed to have to constantly answer questions on this.
The food was excellent, but the portions a bit stingy for the price.
We ordered take out and they forgot to put one of the items. We live not in DC and released it only at home.

The food is wonderful and the staff is even friendlier. Ordered off the restaurant week menu and everything was very good. Takeout was a breeze, but it for those looking to dine in, they have a nice patio and garage bay doors to open up once the weather is a bit warmer for safe, socially distanced eating. Highly recommend -- I'll be back to try other items on the menu

İ had been wanting to try either Tabla or Supra for quite some time but never got around to it. We loved dining at Tabla even though we were outside in the cold. The food was worth it. The traditional dumplings and khalchapori was worth it and I'm looking forward to when I am in the area again to try it.
Went for dine in, we had a very good time/excellent food & service, these guys are on top of covid related protocols, we will be back soon!

Food was pretty tasty but very small servings for the pricing. I got one of the plain cheese khachapuris (oval) and asked of it came with egg, he said yes. But then I got home and there was no egg on it. It was still quite tasty but very small. I like the ones best with the egg and butter that you mix in yourself. I got the veg kabob. It was very average and lacking interesting flavors. Strangely enough, my favorite dish were the fries. Very tasty and great texture. Sauces were solid.
Delicious food and the was great

I am very glad that Supra opened a light version in my neighborhood. I have ordered multiple times, the carrot-walnut pate and the lamb dish, and liked it every time. Hope they bring more red meat options! :)
Great food ... nice vibe
I didn't know what "Georgian" food entailed, but was willing to give it a go! Deliciousness ensued, some vegan, some not, all fantastic! Great service, too. Nice patio in attractive side street.

From the creators of Shaw's Supra comes Table, a casual Georgian restaurant in Park View across the street from the popular bagel shop Call Your Mother Deli. Here's what's to love:  1) Food: They take traditional Georgian dishes like khachapuri (stuffed bread) and khinkali (giant soup dumplings) and add a few twists. For example, they have a dish that puts pork and pomegranate BBQ on  khachapuri (It's delicious!). Their pork and beef dumplings are HUGE so consider ordering three v. six unless you're trying to feed a group. Our toddler loved the imeruli, bread with a cheese filling. The lamb kabobs are well seasoned.  2) Space: It's a beautiful space built well for the pandemic. The walls pull up creating an open space. There are seats inside, but the outdoor patio is even larger. There's also a bar area. Inside are two murals including one that's the D.C. flag with dumplings as the stars.  Overall, Tabla is one of the best takeout food we've had in D.C. since the pandemic started in March 2020. However, I will note the takeout process wasn't as easy as other restaurants. You can't schedule pick-up ahead of time. Instead, the online menu only has an "ASAP" button. Since I wanted to pick up after work at 6pm, I called around 4pm. They told me to call back at 5:20pm to place an order for 6pm. I called back then and was told it would be ready in 20 minutes. Since I couldn't get there in time, they told me to call back at 5:40pm. I did and was told it was a 40-minute wait. I'm sure that the system is built to help the staff, which I support, but be warned it doesn't make for a good customer experience.  Overall, Tabla is an EXCELLENT experience that will make you fall in love with Georgian food.

Another new addition to the neighborhood. The ambience and decor is great. Very modern and clean. 5 stars.  The food is decent but a little overpriced for what it actually is. The place feels more like a fast casual restaurant and less of a dine-in experience. 3 stars  The mixed drinks were barely drinkable. Our server was kind enough to send them back so the bartender could fix/remake them - but there was little improvement. 1 star
Must try restaurant. Great food!
I'll be honest.  We weren't familiar with the cuisine.  But was pleasantly surprised with the healthier food options and  customer service.  Will be going on the regular.
Tasty, authentic, unpretentious Georgian fusion in a lively, happy atmosphere.

Your 2020 troubles can be forgotten while grubbing at this unique and delicious local restaurant. I'd recommend out door seating so you can watch the line across the street as you drink and feast. I have no idea what I got to eat - but I'll be back to order something else next week.
Delicious, unique food and a great setting.
Love this place! The fries are amazing and the Po-boy was excellent. It was super clean and the staff was always busy cleaning and taking good care of the tables and patrons. FULL BAR!!!
Great food and nice vibe.

terrible food, terrible service, food does bot taste Georgian at all.. shaming Georgian people and there religion is all they do... if you are gonna open international restaurant and make money out of it .. at least learn history and be good at It... this people thought it would be good idea to put Georgian icons on bathroom walls and disrespect god, virgin Mary and st.Tamar... you people disgust me... this requires filling a law suite for disrespecting religion freedom. Close the bathrooms before you can take down everything you put in there before others get involved.
take off from restroom georgian saint icons!!!
take off georgian icons from restroom!!!
A comfortable atmosphere. The food was good 👍  The drinks left something to be desired...

We are fans of Supra, so were very excited to see that Tabla opened near our place. We ordered delivery and it was quick and the food traveled well. The “fusion” khachapuri are a great departure from Supra and we loved both of the two we tried - the elote/Mexican street corn megruli and the pork and pomegranate BBQ imeruli. The base of the cheese breads is like pizza crust and pita had a baby and it’s fantastic. We can’t wait to try more of the menu!

Tabla is a wonderful addition to the Parkview neighborhood.  The restaurant is light, open and inviting, the patio spacious and comfortable with open garage type doors for the transition.  Jonathan, the owner, and Alexa, our server, were both extremely knowledgeable, friendly and a joy to talk with.  Not being familiar with Georgian food I came away impressed with the abundance of flavor in all the dishes we tried, the spices are spot on.  The biggest surprise to me was the amber wines, full bodied and flavorful.  Make sure you ask about the story of wines from that region of the world.

Im impressed and now a fan. I haven’t had anything quite like Georgian food before, and it was a real treat. I had the pork belly , and my wife had the elote Mexican Street corn, ajarulis. The spices are really a refreshing taste.  Jonathon was a great help and super friendly. Plus, indoor seating during these times for a rainy day.
Delicious khinkali! Highly recommended!

Came here for brunch on a Sunday. The restaurant was cute and clean. The food was amazing, and much more filling than I thought! I was expecting smaller plates like tapas, but the portions were good and the food was amazing. I’ll definitely come back!
We picked up takeout and it was delicious! We tried a variety of dishes and loved them all. This is a great addition to the neighborhood!
Better than Supra!! Well priced, quality, Georgian food. Everyone should give it a try!

Enjoyed takeout from here. The corn dog, fries, and carrot pate were all great. When picking up staff was friendly and had everything ready to go. Would order takeout again or try dining in. Recommended!

This is a such a wonderful addition to the neighborhood. My husband and I were waited on by Jamie who did such a spectacular job in explaining the menu, telling us the history of the place, and making us feel very welcome. The owners stopped by as well to greet us and make us feel at home. The food was Spectacular! Well done chef! We tried a little of everything and was blown away. We will be back soon!

I’m a big fan of Supra and Georgian food in general and was exited to try out Jonathan and Laura’s new place. The food didn’t disappoint and I loved the interior and the drink options! The adjaruli khachapuri and beef and pork khinkali were delightful!  Understanding it’s a pandemic and restaurants are doing their best, the service wasn’t great. There were as many tables as there were staff working that evening but we only saw our waiter once the whole meal. I would have expected the manager (who was working at the bar) or the waiter who took our order to stop by to see how the meal was but we were largely left alone.

Mediocre at best.  First the good - the Adcharuli Khachapuri (the "cheese boat") was good, with surprisingly tasty cheese. It was the smallest one I have seen in my life, but I can forgive that in DC. The fries were okay, the pkhali was okay.  Then there is the khinkali - no juice inside at all, which is what khinkali is all about. The spicing was not my favorite, but that kind is what some people prefer (the "qalaquri" variant) so it is a personal preference. The overall taste was not horrible, but the small portion size for the money does not leave the client happy.  Then the ugly - The "tkemali" should be thrown in the bin. The "ajika" should be thrown in the bin. Both were watery, slimy, tasteless masses. Neither were what the name said they were. The mtsvadi was not made on embers and was a dried out, tiny piece that any regular cook can make better. The "kababi" was not good either.  So overall, pretty disappointing. It does not help that part of town feels like a crack-den. Also, none of the cooks are Georgian. I think I might have been the only Georgian person there. I guess a few underpaid south-American guys can not be expected to get the Georgian dishes right. Would it be so hard to hire somebody that knows what the good Georgian food actually tastes like?  The waiter was nice and helpful. The interior is nice, though I would not sit on the outdoor seating, because like I said, that part of town looks unsettling.  I really want to like it, but I can not in good conscience give it more than two stars. I will go back at some point and change the rating if it improves, but it does not look good right now. Sorry.

Got takeout today and thoroughly enjoyed the special Georgian fries, as well as the Khinkali and Khachapuri. This place is a more casual alternative to Supra, and hopefully the lower reviews from what sounds like a rough weekend where service kinks had to be worked out won’t dissuade too many from checking it out. If you like Supra, you’ll like Tabla.

Frozen kinkali is bad, shouldn't not be called kinkali, zero juice. Imeruli katkhapuri was pretty good. I'll give this place another try in a couple weeks in hopes of better service and freshly made kinkali. Fella that took my order over the phone shouldn't be in the hospitality business.

I wanted to like it, but the food just left me cold. I ordered the pork and beef khinkali, the mtskheturi gvezeli khachapuri, and the cabbage slaw. The khachapuri was fine.  I was pretty disappointed by the khinkali-- the filling was too salty and way overcooked. The slaw was solid, but it's pickled cabbage, so that's not saying much.  I was also pretty unhappy with the takeout experience. They lost my online order somehow, but they weren't apologetic at all and it took them forever to get it together, even though they have like 9 things on the menu right now. That's annoying by itself, but the worst thing was the owner/manager who kept telling my husband and me it was going to be right out, when it wasn't-- if I'd known I'd be waiting as long as I did, I probably would've chosen to wait outside, given the current conditions.  Hopefully they will get their takeout system together, but I can't see myself ordering from here again.
The food is amazing and reasonably priced. I'm definitely going back!

Great vibe and delicious food. Looking forward to trying everything on this menu. Wine flight was the perfect way to try the Georgian wine options... and they did not disappoint. Clean space, and the indoor/outdoor flow was great for dinning safely.
First time trying Georgian food, very delicious!
I went there today for the soft opening. The food , ambiance, and customer service all superb. Go there and try it before this place inevitably has lines out the door.
New outpost from the vastly popular Georgian restaurant Supra. Can’t wait for this to open!
